question:
[Michele] and her son, [Gino], went to the park, and had a wonderful time. [Joseph] went out for pizza with his sister [Ethel] and his daughter [Alice]. [Michele] took her son [Manuel] to school because he missed the bus. [Charlie] and his sister, [Jami] love it when their grandmother visits because she spoils them. She is coming this week to watch them while their parents are out of town. [Gino] and his sister [Jami] went out for ice cream. [Alice] was excited because today she was going to the zoo with her uncle [William]. [Charlie] asked his aunt, [Ethel], to read him a story. [Ethel] unfortunately was n't able to, since she did n't have her glasses, and she was almost blind without them. [Gino]'s brother, [Manuel], recently made it into town.
Question: How is [William] related to [Gino]?

Step 4: Explain the reasoning behind the relationship:
- By analyzing the family relationships mentioned in the story, we can determine that William is related to Gino through his relationship with Joseph, who is Gino's father. This means that William is Gino's uncle.
